Detailed Description

Provides basic methods for all sessions management

SessionInterface::GetVariable (  $  name  ) 
 

Gets the value associated to variable named $name.

Parameters:
$name The name of the variable to be get.
Returns:
- an object of type Errors in case of error(s)

- the content of the variable named $name

SessionInterface::IsSetVariable (  $  name  ) 
 

Checks whether the varaiable named $name exists or not.

Parameters:
$name The name of the variable to check for
Returns:
- True if a variable named $name exists

- False otherwise

Implemented in Session.

static SessionInterface::SetId (  $  id  )  [static]
 

Sets the session id.

This function must be call before the first call of GetInstance().

Parameters:
$id the id to be set.

Implemented in Session.

SessionInterface::SetVariable (  $  name,
$  value
) 
 

Sets the variable named $name with the value $value. If a variable named $name already exists, it is replaced.

$name must NOT be only numéric or it will not be saved (due to a bug in PHP's API).

Parameters:
$name The name of the variable to be set.
$value The value to be associated to variable named $name

Implemented in Session.

SessionInterface::UnSetVariable (  $  name  ) 
 

Unsets the variable named $name.

Parameters:
$name The name of the variable to be unsetted
Returns:
- an object of type Errors in case of error(s)

- NULL if operation was successful

Implemented in Session.
